Posts.Content: Hi Crystal kitty, I'm glad to hear you're feeling better after the weekend. If you ever need a place to go to within the community to vent, you may want to consider joining the Emotional issues group, as well as The Room. Both are filled with users going through similar experiences to yourself, and are brilliant if you're looking for support. I'd also recommend giving the Macmillan support line a call if you ever feel you need to talk to someone directly. It's available on freephone 0808 808 0000, Mon-Fri, 9am-8pm. Please do give them a ring if you need a listening ear. Take care, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Thank you all for your support ... feeling back on track

Posts.Content: Hi Judyr58, Welcome to the Community, the site that nobody hopes to join. I'm so sorry to hear about your diagnosis but you've definitely come to the right place for support. Although I'm not able to give you any specific medical advice I would recommend you give the cancer advice nurses a call on the Macmillan support line (free to ring on 0808 808 0000, Mon-Fri, 9am-8pm) whilst you wait for other users to reply. Let them know about your taste/smell problem and they'll be able to give you all their relevant advice and suggestions. Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Smells and tastes

Posts.Content: Hello all, On Wednesday the author behind the book of Miss You Already - Morwenna Banks - is coming into the office to record a Q&A session. We're looking to source questions from community members and we want to hear from you! After losing three friends – Deborah,  Victoria and Bethany – to breast cancer over a short period of time, Morwenna Banks wrote the story behind the critically-acclaimed film Miss You Already, and dedicated it to these three women. The film tells the emotional story of a female friendship that is tested by illness, and is based on Banks’s highly-praised 2013 radio play, Goodbye. Have you got a question you want to ask? Perhaps you want to know how she supported her friends through their diagnoses? Did writing help her grief process? If you have got something you want to ask just comment in our blog post (where you can also watch the trailer for the film). Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Any questions for Morwenna Banks, author of Miss You Already?

Posts.Content: Hi Rich1984, Love to see that you've joined the Community to help support your girlfriend - and look at all the support you've had so far! I don't think anyone has mentioned it yet, but Macmillan actually runs it's own book reviewing service, and we feature weekly Book Club posts here on the Community. You can find our previous posts here; we featured books exclusively on breast cancer during October (Breast Cancer Awareness Month), so one of those titles might be of interest. Macmillan's entire back catalogue can be found here (a downloadable PDF file, so fingers crossed it works for you!). Best wishes to you and Sara, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Books on breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi luceylocket, I have tagged RBee1 so they will get a notification of your kind words. Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: messag for Rbee1

Posts.Content: Hi Bridgets-21, I'm sorry to hear about your current difficulties with joint pain and cording. It sounds as if you are having a really hard time at the moment. I'm sure other members will be along soon with their own suggestions and advice. In the meantime, I recommend you post your queries into our Ask a nurse discussion. As it's run by Macmillan nurses, they will be able to give you any further information they have that may help you. Let them know about your hypermobility and the build-up of scar tissue - they should be able to help you. To post a question just click into the discussion, click any of the 'Reply' buttons, and then type in your message. A nurse will get back in touch with you shortly. Also, don't forget that you can always ring the Macmillan support line if you would like to speak to someone directly. Available on freephone 0808 808 0000, Monday to Friday, 9am-8pm. I hope this helps. Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy Scarring and Tamoxifen Problens

Posts.Content: Love this topic! After the last six months - lots of heartbreak - Florence + The Machine's 'Third Eye' has become my own personal anthem. 'Hey, look up! You don't have to be a ghost, Here amongst the living. You are flesh and blood! And you deserve to be loved and you deserve what you are given.' Jazmine
Posts.Title: Anthem

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, We have locked this topic because our guidelines request discussions are kept helpful and supportive: This community offers a space for a wide range of people, many of whom have been affected by cancer. Please focus on supportive and sensitive discussions and always be sympathetic to other members’ feelings...We ask you to be tolerant and respectful of other members’ beliefs and opinions at all times. We have already posted a reminder to ask that you follow our guidelines in regards to being supportive and respecting other members. Any questions, please get in touch by emailing community@macmillan.org.uk.  Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Does anyone know anything about PIP?

Posts.Content: Hi Judyr58, I'm sorry to hear you've experienced problems applying to become a Cancer Voice. If you email the team at cancervoices@macmillan.org.uk I'm sure they can help you. Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi Sophie236, I'm going to send you an email about this issue. Keep an eye on your personal email inbox. Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hello all, We wanted to make you aware of our new Ask a dietitian feature, available on the community. Much like Ask a benefits adviser and Ask a nurse, dietitian Jenny is on hand to answer any questions you have about diet, food and weight management. - Jazmine
Posts.Title: New 'Ask a dietitian' feature available

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn28/all, I'm sorry to hear that some are experiencing issues submitting complaints via the online form. I've just test sent one and it worked (on Chrome). If you experience problems or are shown a 404 message, please try again or try sending one from a different browser. If you continue to experience issues, please do get in touch with us (community@macmillan.org.uk) and we can help. Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi Isingbass, Thanks for your question. You need to click into the Ask a dietitian thread to ask Jenny herself. Here's the link: https://community.macmillan.org.uk/cancer_experiences/ask_the_expert/f/34903/t/103916  Once you are on the thread, click any of the 'Reply' buttons and copy your questions into the text box. Let us know if you need any further help by emailing community@macmillan.org.uk. Take care, Jazmine
Posts.Title: New 'Ask a dietitian' feature available

Posts.Content: Hi again, To reassure everyone, the Awake thread will be unlocked once moderation action is taken. Please bear with us while we sort this. Thank you, Jazmine
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: Hi WORRIED2016, Brilliant news, I'm so happy for you! This Christmas is definitely one to celebrate. I'm glad to hear that the Community has been a source of support for you. Best wishes for the future, Jazmine
Posts.Title: I have my results

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, LondonLass - I'm so sorry to hear about what's happened. If you need extra support, please do email us as community@macmillan.org.uk and we can help. For now, we ask that moderation issues are not discussed on the Community, while we sort everything out, as it makes situations like this more complicated. Thanks, Jazmine
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: Hi Rhonda, I'm sorry to hear about your intense hot flushes. I'm sure other members will be along soon with their own experiences and support. In the meantime, you might want to post your questions into our Ask a nurse thread, as it's run by Macmillan nurses who will be able to give you lots of advice. Just click into the thread, click any of the 'Reply' buttons and then type in your message. A nurse will get back to you shortly. The Macmillan support line is always there too, if you would prefer to speak to someone directly. Available on freephone 0808 808 0000, Monday to Friday, 9am-8pm. Also, I'm sure you have done a lot of reading around Tamoxifen already, but if you wanted to find out more I would recommend this fact sheet on the drug and its side effects. Take care, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Too Many Hot Flushes

Posts.Content: Hi StormyLovesOdd, Welcome to the Online Community. I'm so sorry to hear about your diagnosis, but I'm glad to hear that your active treatment has finished, and you're planning ahead. I'd recommend taking a look at our travel insurance blog - scroll to the bottom and click through to the comments. Lots of other members have posted their own suggestions for companies, so do take a look. The main Macmillan site has advice on what to declare to insurance companies, so hopefully this will help you when taking out a policy.  I hope this helps. Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Holiday insurance ??

Posts.Content: Hi all, As many of you will be aware, October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, and to mark it we're looking for guest bloggers. If you're interested in finding out more or would like to get involved just email community@macmillan.org.uk, with FAO Jazmine as the subject line. Hope to hear from some of you soon. Jazmine
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Awareness Month - want to blog?

Posts.Content: Hi shaz15, I'm really sorry to hear about your current situation - hopefully other users taking tamoxifen will be along soon with some helpful advice. In the meantime this fact sheet on tamoxifen might help you as it discusses the possible side effects that can occur. I'd also recommend speaking to your GP/BCN, as well as giving the Macmillan support line a call - they'll be able to give you any relevant advice and support over the phone. They're available on freephone 0808 808 0000, Monday to Friday, 9am - 8pm. Give them a ring when you can. Take care, Jazmine

Posts.Content: Further to Michael - Macmillan's comment, you can find the full list of books reviewed by Macmillan here (it'll download as a PDF file). Jazmine

Posts.Content: Hi Always Baking , I suggest you take a look at the comments section of our travel insurance blog. Other members have left their recommendations - and there's a lot to choose from (180 comments worth!). I'm sure you'll find something to suit your needs. Best wishes, Jazmine
Posts.Title: Anyone recommend a . good travel insurance comp after chemo's ?

Posts.Content: Hi Always Baking , If you scroll to the bottom of the blog itself you should see these buttons: Click the grey right-hand arrows and you'll be taken to the last page of suggestions (most recent comment is from 15th September). I'm afraid you'll have to copy and paste your question into the text box and post it again. However, other members don't tend to reply to blog comments, they just post their suggestions, so have a read through the comments. Jazmine

Posts.Content: Thank-you for reporting this issue to us. We'd really appreciate it if you could email us (community@macmillan.org.uk) and let us know more about what's happening when you try to send private messages. We can then look into the problem. Thanks again, Jazmine
